definition[0]: to try to end a quarrel between two people, groups, countries etc
example[0]: The former president has agreed to mediate the peace talks.
example[1]: UN officials mediated between the rebel fighters and the government.
example[2]: The court was set up to mediate in civil disputes.
definition[1]: to change the effect or influence of something, especially to make the effect less bad
example[3]: Exercise may mediate the effects of a bad diet.
definition[2]: to try to end an argument between two people or groups by talking to both sides and encouraging them to reach an agreement
example[4]: He was asked to mediate a labor dispute.
example[5]: an ombudsman who will mediate between disgruntled investors and product providers
